newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil TBC cut to 1.88 pct in September - paper.
newsitem.headline: Brazil TBC cut to 1.88 pct in September - paper.

text.p: Brazil's Committee of Monetary Policy (Copom) has cut September's Basic Interest Rate of the Central Bank (TBC) for its operations in the financial markets to 1.88 percent, Gazeta Mercantil newspaper said.
The TBC, which is set on a monthly basis and was first introduced in July, is used as a reference rate for Central Bank rediscount lines and Proer credit lines.
The July and August TBC were set at 1.9 percent.
Copom has signalled only a small reduction in interest rates to spare financial markets unpleasant surprises in the future, should the rate have to be raised again, the newspaper said.
-- Simona de Logu, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 507 4151
